learningPlan.title: Learning Plan
learningPlan.shortdesc: Learning plan for an introductory lesson on ontologies and semantic data modeling.

lcPlanTitle.p: Lesson 4: Introduction to Ontologies and Competency Questions

lcPlanSubject.title: Focus
lcPlanSubject.p: This lesson will focus on developing a methodology for defining semantic models. It will incorporate structures provided by the RDF Schema standard.

lcPlanDescrip.title: Overview
lcPlanDescrip.p: In this lession, participants will be challenged to apply RDF Schema (RDFS) concepts to the task of developing a domain model for library information resources. Participants will be introduced to the concept of applied ontology and will be challenged to think holistically about knowledge organization and representation.

lcPlanPrereqs.title: Prerequisites
lcPlanPrereqs.p: As preparation for this lesson, participants will have understood the basics of the RDF model and syntax and RDFS concepts such as Resource, Class, Property, and Literal.

lcInterventionItem.lcLearnStrat: Gain learner attention and provide motivation for the topic of ontologies and why they are relevant in the context of library metadata.
lcInterventionItem.lcPlanObjective: The goal of instruction is to define what an ontology is and give concrete examples, while preparing learners for the competency questions activity.
lcInterventionItem.lcAssessment: Check for comprehension of content with a brief quiz.
lcInterventionItem.lcDelivery: Content will be delivered in lecture format. Define what an ontology is, provide examples, and introduce the idea of competency questions in the context of domain modeling methodology.

lcInterventionItem.lcLearnStrat: Participants will use inductive reasoning to develop a set of competency questions for a domain ontology about library information resources.
lcInterventionItem.lcPlanObjective: They will define the scope and requirements of the ontology and identify key concepts and terminology.
lcInterventionItem.lcAssessment: The activity will be assessed through group discussion and reflection.
lcInterventionItem.lcDelivery: Participants will work in groups of four to five people. They will brainstorm competency questions, write them on Post-it notes, and organize the questions into meaningful groups.
